overview_of_class:
Operator algebras and non-commutative geometry

Historically, operator algebras arose as an abstraction of the idea of the space of continuous functions on a topological space: except that now, we allow these functions to violate the commutativity rule xy=yx. Their study is a subject that combines the best of algebra and analysis. Its most important applications have been to quantum theory, but it crops up all over modern mathematics.

This seminar will cover a selection of the following topics: bounded and compact operators on Hilbert space; C*-algebras; the classification of commutative C*-algebras; Fredholm operators; Toeplitz operators and an introduction to K-theory.
